msItem.title: Portions of the Gospel of S. John, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: Viz. ch. iii. 2—28, iv. 50—52, and v. 1—3.

item.p: All leaves are more or less stained and torn.

layout.p: There are 14 or 15 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The handwriting is inelegant, of the11th or 12th centuries.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

msItem.title: A portion of the first part of a Choir-book, comprising Psalms xlvi. 5—lx. 6, according to the Peshitta version.
msItem.note: The Psalms are numbered, the ܡܪ̈ܡܝܬܐ and ܫܘ̈ܒܚܐ marked, and the versicles divided as usual by ܗ.

item.p: Five vellum leaves, about 5 1/2 in. by 4 1/4, with from 17 to 19 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is rather inelegant, of the xiiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns of Severus
msItem.note: Foll. 12 b and 13 a contain the hymns of Severus , but according to a different arrangement, which the scribe presently abandoned, commencing afresh on fol. 13 b.

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns (ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܡ̈ܥܢܝܬܐ) of Severus
msItem.rubric: ܒܚܝ̣ܠ ܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܟܝ̇ܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܠܝܬ݂ܝ ܩ̈ܢܘܡܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܡܫ̇ܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬ݂ܘܒ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܡ̈ܥܢܝܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܣܐܘܝܪܐ ܦܐܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܕܐܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ. ܐܝܟ ܬ݁ܘܪܨܐ ܚ̣ܕܬܐ ܟܠ ܚܕܐ ܒܬܪ ܒܪܬ ܫܘܼܒܚܗ
msItem.note: These hymns are for the Nativity, ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠ̣ܕܐ, 14 in number, and the first three for the Epiphany, ܕܒܝܬ ܕܢܚ̣ܐ. Each hymn is accompanied by letters on the margin, indicating its number and the tone according to which it is chanted.

item.p: Ten vellum leaves, about 6 in. by 3 7/8, forming the first quire of a neatly written manuscript of the xith cent., (Add. 14,524, foll. 12—21). There are from 20 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: Neatly written, of the xith cent.

msItem.title: Portions of the Hymns of Severus
On Palm Sunday, ܨܘ to ܩܐ

item.p: Eight vellum leaves, about 5 3/8 in. by 3 3/4, the last two of which are slightly torn. There are from 21 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: They are written in a small and rather neat hand of the xith cent.

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns of Severus, etc.
The hymns for the Resurrection, arranged according to the eight tones
The hymns for S. Thomas and S. John the Evangelist

item.p: Eighteen vellum leaves, about 5 1/8in. by 3 3/4, the last of which is much torn (Add. 14,524, foll. 30—47), with from 13 to 18 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is of the xiiith cent.

msItem.title: Portions of the Hymns of Severus

item.p: Twenty vellum leaves, about 5 in. by 3 1/2, nearly all of which are more or less stained and torn.

handNote.desc: They are written in an inelegant hand of the xith or xiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.category: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
